publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1522# Irene Oldfather: Modern Languages—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Citizens of a Multilingual World by the Ministerial Action Group on Languages; notes the initiatives already being carried out across Scotland to promote teaching of modern languages, including the Virtual School of Modern Languages in North Ayrshire, East Ayrshire and Argyll and Bute, and calls for a greater recognition of the importance of modern languages in 2001, designated European Year of Languages.

S1M-1522# Irene Oldfather: Modern Languages—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Citizens of a Multilingual World by the Ministerial Action Group on Languages; notes the initiatives already being carried out across Scotland to promote teaching of modern languages, including the Virtual School of Modern Languages in North Ayrshire, East Ayrshire and Argyll and Bute, and calls for a greater recognition of the importance of modern languages in 2001, designated European Year of Languages.
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Michael Russell*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Margaret Jamieson*

S1M-1522# Irene Oldfather: Modern Languages—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Citizens of a Multilingual World by the Ministerial Action Group on Languages; notes the initiatives already being carried out across Scotland to promote teaching of modern languages, including the Virtual School of Modern Languages in North Ayrshire, East Ayrshire and Argyll and Bute, and calls for a greater recognition of the importance of modern languages in 2001, designated European Year of Languages. Supported by: Cathy Jamieson, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Adam Ingram, Margaret Jamieson
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Andrew Wilson*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Irene McGugan*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1522# Irene Oldfather: Modern Languages—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Citizens of a Multilingual World by the Ministerial Action Group on Languages; notes the initiatives already being carried out across Scotland to promote teaching of modern languages, including the Virtual School of Modern Languages in North Ayrshire, East Ayrshire and Argyll and Bute, and calls for a greater recognition of the importance of modern languages in 2001, designated European Year of Languages. Supported by: Cathy Jamieson, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Adam Ingram, Margaret Jamieson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Pauline McNeill, Dr Elaine Murray, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr Jamie Stone, Irene McGugan, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-1522# Modern Languages (lodged on 11 January 2001) Cathy Peattie*
